scaleme.midnightconfig.title: ScaleMe - Visual Scaling
scaleme.midnightconfig.ownPlayerDescript: Change the visual size of your own player model
scaleme.midnightconfig.ownPlayerScale.to: Controls how large or small your own player appears visually
scaleme.midnightconfig.ownPlayerSmoothSc: Gradually transition between scale changes for your own player
scaleme.midnightconfig.otherPlayersDescr: Change the visual size of other players' models
scaleme.midnightconfig.enableOtherPlayer: Allow scaling of other players' models (visual only)
scaleme.midnightconfig.otherPlayersScale: Controls how large or small other players appear visually
scaleme.midnightconfig.otherPlayersSmoot: Gradually transition between scale changes for other players
scaleme.midnightconfig.applyToAllPlayers: Use the 'Other Players Scale' setting for all players, including yourself
scaleme.midnightconfig.playerPresetsDesc: Create custom scaling profiles for specific players
scaleme.midnightconfig.enablePlayerPrese: Allow custom scale settings for individual players
scaleme.midnightconfig.playerPresetsConf: Path to the JSON file storing player-specific scaling settings
scaleme.midnightconfig.showQuickAddButto: Show Quick Add Button in Chat
Display a button in chat to quickly add players to your presets
scaleme.midnightconfig.autoDetectUUIDs.t: Automatically retrieve player UUIDs from their names when possible
scaleme.gui.presets.title: Player Scaling. Set a custom scale for specific players.
scaleme.gui.presets.search.placeholder: Search by name, identifier, or category
scaleme.gui.presets.add_custom.title: Add Custom Player Preset
scaleme.gui.presets.edit_custom.title: Edit Custom Player Preset
scaleme.gui.preset.help: Tip: Use UUID for permanent identification, Username for flexibility
scaleme.gui.preset.identifier.tooltip: Enter a player's username or UUID.
scaleme.gui.preset.display_name.tooltip: Optional display name in list for this preset. If empty, the identifier will be used. Useful to set when using UUID as identifier.
scaleme.gui.preset.category.tooltip: Choose a category to organize your presets. You can create new categories or use existing ones.
scaleme.gui.preset.scale.tooltip: Set the scale multiplier for this player (0.1x to 3.0x).
scaleme.gui.presets.sort.name: Name
scaleme.gui.presets.tooltip.name: Name: %s
scaleme.gui.presets.search.placeholder.d: Search by name, category, or scaleâ€¦
scaleme.gui.category.new.title: Add New Category
scaleme.gui.presets.list_empty.add_promp: Click 'Add' to create a new one.
scaleme.gui.category.delete.confirm.mess: Delete category '%s'? Presets will be moved to 'default'.
